text: What does this sign warn you is ahead?
options: Pedestrians are not allowed in this area
School zone or school crossing ahead
Children must stay on the sidewalk
explanation: This sign warns drivers that children may be crossing the road. You should slow down, watch carefully for children, and be prepared to stop.

text: What does this sign indicate about the road ahead?
What does this sign require you to do?
explanation: A stop sign is eight-sided and has a red background with white letters. It means you must come to a complete stop. Stop at the stop line if it is marked on the pavement. If there is no stop line, stop at the crosswalk. If there is no crosswalk, stop at the edge of the sidewalk. If there is no sidewalk, stop at the edge of the intersection. Wait until the way is clear before entering the intersection.

text: Unless otherwise posted, what is the maximum speed limit in cities, towns, and villages?
explanation: Where there are no posted speed limits, the maximum speed is 50 km/h in cities, towns and villages.

text: When approaching this sign, how should drivers respond?
options: Reduce speed and be prepared to stop
explanation: This sign warns drivers to slow down and be ready to stop due to changing traffic conditions ahead.

text: If your turn signals are not working, what should you do?
explanation: If your turn signals and brake lights are not working, use hand and arm signals.

text: What should drivers do when they see this detour sign?
options: Ignore the detour if familiar with the area
Follow the detour marker until returning to the regular route
explanation: Detour signs guide drivers along a temporary route until normal traffic flow resumes.

text: When should you use your turn signals?
options: Before stopping, turning, changing lanes, or leaving the road
Only when other vehicles are close by.
explanation: Use your turn signals and brake lights to signal before stopping, slowing down, turning, changing lanes, leaving the road or moving out from a parked position.

text: What is the minimum distance required when passing a cyclist?
explanation: Drivers of motor vehicles must maintain a minimum distance of one metre, where practical. [cite: 722]

text: What does a cyclist extending their right arm straight out indicate?
explanation: Cyclists may signal right turns by holding their right arms straight out.
